intro: Machaerina schoenoides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters during the summer months. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
